intro: Calathiana orbicularis, commonly known as the orbicular calathia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its distinctive orbicular (rounded) leaves and showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. Calathiana orbicularis is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in supporting local insect populations.
